title: A Lab Gets a New Name: What It Means for Energy
summary: The National Renewable Energy Laboratory in Colorado has been renamed the National Laboratory of the Rockies by the Trump administration. This lab is famous for studying wind, solar, and other clean energy sources. The new name is part of a bigger plan to focus on all types of energy, not just renewable ones. Some people worry this change might mean less support for clean energy research, which could hurt America's ability to compete with countries like China and India. The lab's director says the new name honors the beautiful Rocky Mountains where the lab is located, but he didn't explain how the lab's work will change. This renaming is one of several actions by the government to shift attention away from renewable energy toward fossil fuels like oil and coal.

background_read: The National Renewable Energy Laboratory is a big research center in Colorado that studies clean energy like wind and solar power. It helps the U.S. find new ways to make energy without polluting. The Trump administration has made changes to focus more on oil and coal, which can harm the environment. This article talks about how renaming the lab might affect its work and America's role in clean energy around the world.
Article_Structure: WHO: The Trump administration and lab director Jud Virden
WHAT: Renamed the National Renewable Energy Laboratory to the National Laboratory of the Rockies
WHERE: Golden, Colorado in the Rocky Mountains
WHY: To shift focus from renewable energy to all energy types, part of a broader plan to support fossil fuels

perspectives.description: The name change reflects a new focus on all energy sources, not just renewables, to honor the lab's location.
